title: Gavin Newsom Cancels Christmas Tree Ceremony To Avoid/Appease Planned Pro-Palestinian Protests
description:
California Governor Gavin Newsom canceled the annual live public Christmas tree lighting that had been scheduled for Tuesday because of “protests across the country.” Although it is unclear which protests may have triggered the decision, it is possible it had something to do with the protests that disrupted the annual lighting of the giant Christmas trees at Rockefeller Center where several people were subsequently arrested.

title: National WOMEN'S Law Center President: Female Athletes Should “Learn to Lose Gracefully” Against Trans Competitors
description:

Graves believes this is the better alternative, rather than keeping men out of women's sports altogether.

title: Watch: Did Donald Trump Just Admit He Wants To Be a Dictator?!
description:
Donald Trump did a town hall event with Sean Hannity in Iowa and the media is already freaking out. Today’s show gets into that.

Trump joined Fox News' "Hannity" on Tuesday night for a town hall discussion on the presidential primary, Biden, dictatorships, and more.

Trump got the media working overtime with his comments to Hannity's question asking him to pledge to "never abuse power as retribution against anybody."

"Except for day one," Trump said. "I want to close the border and I want to drill, drill, drill."

title: Watch: DINKs are the new TikTok trend bragging about not having kids, but they just look like losers
description:
Yes, Die Hard is a Christmas Movie! Dare your friends to change your mind with our new Christmas long sleeve!

As I'm sure most of you have seen on the interwebs, DINKs are the latest viral rage. It stands for "Dual Income, No Kids." I would call them "Couple Under Counting Kids," but to each their own. Couples, presumably married, bragging about how awesome their lives are without children.

description:

title: Watch: KJP Said WHAT When Cornered On Democrat Congresswoman's Rape Apologizing for Hamas?!
description:
White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre is once again dancing around questions. This time it was on the View. So many softball questions but so little time for KJP. Because she is refusing to share her stance on whether she believes Rep. Pramila Jayapal needs to clarify her comments about Hamas’ sexual violence.

During an interview on CNN on Sunday, Jayapal was asked about claims that progressives have been silent about Hamas’ sexual violence during the Oct. 7 attacks.

“I think we have to be balanced about bringing in the outrages against Palestinians,” Jayapal said. “Fifteen thousand Palestinians have been killed in Israeli airstrikes, three-quarters of whom are women and children.”
